website_summaries.verdict: A neatly organized value set that also includes decorating tips for frosting your cookies.
pros: Easy and quick to use and clean (dishwasher safe)
Comes with 14 aluminum discs for a variety of shapes
Also comes with 6 decorating tips, recipes, and a handy storage box to keep it all organized
cons: Hand wash recommended, especially the disks, which can be damaged in the dishwasher

customer_reviews.title: this is a good one for that
customer_reviews.text: Really flimsy. Do not over fill the reservoir because the press doesn't have the structural integrity to push that much dough. Also, make sure your dough is room temperature first (same reason as not putting too much in.) Honestly, if you have a press from the 1960s/1970s, keep that one! If you want to express frosting on cake, this is a good one for that.
customer_reviews.author: isfcco

customer_reviews.title: Love it But Need More Experience Using It
customer_reviews.text: I'm on the fence with this. The dough continued to stick to the press and didn't wanna come out very easily. I will have to play with it some more. The cookies though turned out fabulous. I also made icing. I used a very good sugar cookie recipe. A copy-cat recipe of Cheryl's Cookies. Tastes just like them without the steep price. Mmmmm 😋😋😋 As far as shipping, the packer needed to wrap the case with bubble wrap. There was none. The case could've come cracked. Luckily it didn't.
customer_reviews.author: MsPittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: Blah
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was hoping for. The same as every other press. I wanted a press that I could press with one hand while guiding the dough with the other. I had one that worked like that for 20 years, and haven't been able to find a replacement. I will now add this Kuhn Rikon to the cookie press cemetery I have in my closet...this makes 8 buried in there now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the kit once but it's much easier than other methods I've found of filing or decorating. I like it and it's a nice item to have around in those times when you have small pastry shells to fill or needs a good decorating tool.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl W.

customer_reviews.title: not very durable but easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used this for cheese straws. It was easy to assemble, easy to use, easy to clean, and the see thru barrel also helped with knowing when to reload. Can't wait to use for spritz cookies! UPDATE- have used it a total of three times and only for cheese straws. The ratcheting mechanism slips so I have to continuously press on the lever using my other hand. Very difficult and makes the straws unattractive looking. I'm going to have to get another cookie press
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Red

customer_reviews.title: exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: as described. I used my own cookie recipe so some discs weren't able to produce any biscuit. They said if I try the recipes provided with it, it will work better, will give it a try and update. I handwash it though it says dishwasher safe except for the discs. The pressure to release cookies is very easy, usage of the cones or tips is very easy as well. I would recommend it. More cookies on the way!
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This one actually works! We've been through about 5 cookie presses and none of them have worked. Either the end pops off, dough leaks out the sides, or the cookie size is too big or small to be shaped properly. This one is easy to operate and makes consistently sized cookies.
customer_reviews.author: C. Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed using this to make Christmas cookies. Worked great, cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty58

customer_reviews.title: Get this kind
customer_reviews.text: This not only works as a shape press but also as a pastry bag for decorating. The instructions are excellent, the workmanship is excellent and it is neater and easier than the metal one I grew up with.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cookies press
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is easy to clean. My husband used it to make cookies and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best I have used.
customer_reviews.text: I have had three different brands. This is the best thus far, aside from the one my mother used for my whole childhood.
customer_reviews.author: Hewitt house

customer_reviews.title: SUPERB SPRITZ COOKIES!
customer_reviews.text: Got this press today and was excited to use it. I have tried numerous other plastic disc presses and have come to the conclusion that the metal discs are the ticket! The Kuhn Rikon produces a nice cookie shape with many pattern choices. Instruction booklet is specific about NOT refrigerating the dough prior to use and NOT using non-stick pans. It suggests using cool, clean baking sheets, stoneware works best. It comes with recipes, however, I used my grandmothers favorite and it works just as well. I even colored the dough and it still perfected each cookie. This press is well made and comes in a great storage box that I will be sure to pass on to my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Koreen M. Nalesnik

customer_reviews.title: Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: I researched cookie presses and decided on this one. Most of the reviews were positive but when I tried to use it, I was very frustrated. While the components are of good quality, the attachment that holds the pattern shape to the end of the press does not screw on (like the older model). Instead, it slides into a guide and turns. The pressure of the cookie dough pushes the end piece off and the pattern disk is pushed off. Extremely frustrating. If only the end piece had a way to screw it on.
customer_reviews.author: M. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this cookie press
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cookie press. It is easy to use, makes beautiful cookies, cleans up well and is everything it was promised to be. Would recommed it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: maggee frick

customer_reviews.title: This company makes quality products.
customer_reviews.text: Love the product better if it had the sawtooth disc! I need a sawtooth.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Plott

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like this for cookies, not so much for frosting. I like a steady flow for frosting and this uses a gun/pump motion. It works well for cookies, though, but the one thing I don't like is that the barrel is so narrow. I wish it was much wider so I didn't have to refill with cookie batter as often. But it is a nice product, cleans pretty easily and has lots of disk shapes for the cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon cookie press
customer_reviews.text: Works good, I use it to fill small pastry, I bought the tip I needed at a local store, it makes the job easy to control the filling inserted, some of the filling gets behind the plunger, but it can be scraped back into the tube, no big problem, common for this in other presses.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy

customer_reviews.title: Requires constant dough-tinkering to keep it working correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well unless dough is "wet" enough. Will often pop open under required pressure to advance piston if it's not happy with the dough's consistency. A better connection between cap and tube would solve this rather simply. Otherwise, will do the job if you're willing to revisit dough consistency with each tube-full.
customer_reviews.author: Crit_Zer0

customer_reviews.title: Magic cookie press
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item with some trepidation - I usually mistrust gadgets. It was delivered really fast. I immediately set about making some cookies with it and I'm STILL grinning from ear to ear. Its easy, creative, clean and very very satisfying to use. One tiny caution, wipe the cylinder and your hands before each load, it gets a bit slippery. I love the box it comes in, makes storage so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanetta

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but disappointed
customer_reviews.text: at first, I was thrilled with how easy it was to pump out perfect cookie shapes with little effort. Later on, though, the bottom end kept popping off, as others have reported. Thankfully, I didn't have too much dough left at that point so I just formed some shapes by hand. I'm going to try it again tomorrow, and not refrigerate the dough at all (even though I thought I had softened it enough when I made these cookies), and try to hold the bottom in place so it doesn't pop out and hope that works.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: OK gadget!
customer_reviews.text: A little pricy for what it is, Hope the plastic pieces hold up. It's a lot like a caulking gun, product (frosting) continues to flow after the last click of the trigger. overall it works ok, a lot better than my old frosting kit. Have not tried it with dough yet. Looks like it might be difficult to load with dough.
customer_reviews.author: rlbcomputer

customer_reviews.title: Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the cookie press to replace a cookie press from "Pampered Chef". The primary function of this press is to "fill" deviled eggs; however, the tips are not large enough to work for this purpose. Additionally, the plunger does not fit tight enough inside the tube and thethe mixture gets through to the top of the plunger, requiring constant cleaning. Perhaps with cookie dough, it will work better.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Crary

customer_reviews.title: and I found this one to be pretty user-friendly. Some shapes are harder than others
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a cookie press before (old or new style), and I found this one to be pretty user-friendly. Some shapes are harder than others, like the butterfly, but the flowers, star, abstract, and heart all turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: Amar

customer_reviews.title: Finally a cookie press that works!
customer_reviews.text: After using my mother's old press, I decided to get my own. I tried at least 3 others before this one. The others were returned to various stores but I am keeping this one. No problems at all. I would recommend this one to the amateur cookie baker.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great For Holiday Cookies
customer_reviews.text: We use this to make holiday cookies. The kids love to operate it and love the shapes. It's a little more fun than rolling out balls of dough. This press was a good quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cookie press. It is so easy to use. Just follow the directions. I love the bake cookies for the children at church. This product makes it easy on me.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Works great for churros and frosting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make churros and it works pretty well for that though I wish it was a bit bigger. My wife quickly adopted it for frosting cupcakes and she absolutely loves it. haven't tried it for cookies yet but I'm sure we'll get around to it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McLain

customer_reviews.title: I like the trigger design and the decorating accessories are wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I like the trigger design and the decorating accessories are wonderful. However, the plastic tube was too weak for even the sugar cookies I was making so that the tip popped off several times.
customer_reviews.author: susan stark

customer_reviews.title: A great piece of cooking equipment for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I use it to stuff peppers. (Jalapenos) Will most likely crank out a few thousand cookies this holiday season! Only wish it came with a vampire template.
customer_reviews.author: J.E.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Over the holidays, I gave the press quite a workout and it worked like a champ. I followed the tip sheet which was helpful. There are plenty of cookie shapes, but I would liked to have had a few more traditional shapes.
customer_reviews.author: dscnm

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME better than electric
customer_reviews.text: Great product! love it, very happy. I was used to the electric version but this is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: R. Novello

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Tps and disks and easy to use and clean. Cheese straws and cookies big hit for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Chef C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This item works great. Make sure to spend the extra money & buy this one. Definitely worth the the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Best cookie press we have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best cookie press we have ever owned. Went through a few before we found this one. Sturdy and the storage case is a great idea. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy for Shopping

customer_reviews.title: The piping tips seem to be a waste, I doubt I'll ever have a reason to ...
customer_reviews.text: The piping tips seem to be a waste, I doubt I'll ever have a reason to use them over a piping bag - but the cookie press is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: writeZoe

customer_reviews.title: Cookie Press for the 21st Century!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Cookie presses have sure come a long way since the one my mom had many years ago. Very easy to use and the cookies come out great. However, the reason for the four stars instead of five is that when I put the cake decorating tips on, the icing kept coming out really fast and I couldn't stop it. Anyone know why it does that?
customer_reviews.author: Patty Dombovy

customer_reviews.title: Great item and a terrific valve
customer_reviews.text: Great item and a terrific valve!!! Service and shipping were impeccable .. Would highly recommend this product and this company!! Dan - Long Island , NY
customer_reviews.author: D. Rich

customer_reviews.title: It worked well, but I have only uses it ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked well, but I have only uses it once so I can speak to it's endurance. It has more plastic on it than I would prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Busymomma

customer_reviews.title: Good quality decorating gun
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to decorate the gingerbread house which we made for Christmas. It works great for this purpose. We'd been looking for a long time for a product that fit this bill. The consistency of the frosting was just right for this decorating gun. We give it a 2 thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia L Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Nice cookie press
customer_reviews.text: This cookie press was easy to use and worked great! I have tried several that either won't push the dough through or break after first use. I have not used decorating bottle yet but I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 different guns for filling lady locks and not one met my expectations. This chalking type gun met all my expectations and more. Anyone who bakes cookies or makes lady locks this is a must for them. It was also inexpensive compared to my other purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Great compact storage case! I haven't used it yet but it fits in the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love
customer_reviews.text: I had a metal one before, and it did not work well at all. This was awesome! The lever works well in pushing down the dough and it is extremely easy to clean. Makes nice size cookies too!!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Naranjo

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I was replacing a Pampered Chef model that worked better but this one also is a cookie press.
customer_reviews.author: JW MILLER

customer_reviews.title: must have
customer_reviews.text: easy to use easy to clean has many uses good product
customer_reviews.author: thomasengle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cookies every time
customer_reviews.text: Perfect cookies every time! Love this one. Bought to replace a 40 year old press that just went out. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Marrah

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: worked very well for spritz cookies; tried to use for decorating cookies with frosting, that was a bit cumbersome. My next task will be a cake, so we'll see. Otherwise, I liked the solid feel to the press, not cheap feeling at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tara M

customer_reviews.title: Ideal For Cookie Dough - Heavy Duty Press!
customer_reviews.text: Was after a cookie dough injector for making Churros & this is definitely fit for that purpose. - In reviewing Piping Guns there seems to be plenty around but not all can handle the cookie dough without leaking but the "Kuhn Rikon" seems to be heavy duty & handles dough easily - Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It actually works
customer_reviews.text: Bought This as a Christmas present for my girl friend who is an avid cooker/baker and she uses it all the time. It hasn't broke and it makes baking quicker and easier for her.
customer_reviews.author: Dwehr24

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon Clear Cookie Press - Fantastic product easy to use, clean, and directions easy to follow!
customer_reviews.text: Love the storage box and the cookie press. It works very easy compared to what I had years ago. Directions are easy to follow and clean up is quick!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Weston

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on cookie press
customer_reviews.text: Love it, it was in very good condition with all the pieces. It is just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Christmas cookies with my new cookie press
customer_reviews.text: The Cookie Press worked great. Much easier than the Mirro Cookie Press that I used previously. Can't wait to try it again.
customer_reviews.author: JANICE DVORACEK

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon Clear Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I really like the clear tube so that I can see the amount in it, There are many uses for the press.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth N. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Just at the first time I've tried to use it and accidentally dropped the device from height maybe 20 cm, and it have cracked right through whole plastic tube. I can't say the stroke was strong, it's just the thin and cheap plastic :(
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It worked well and I followed the recipe in box but I would leave out the cardoman spice.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Kuester

customer_reviews.title: Bought this is a wedding shower gift very happy with this item
customer_reviews.text: Bought this is a wedding shower gift very happy with this item
customer_reviews.author: patricia hoberg

customer_reviews.title: best cookie press since the 1940's
customer_reviews.text: I had a metal cookie press from my mother years ago, after baking butter spritz's every year the it finally broke two years ago. I have purchased several to replace it but no luck as the presses couldnt work the dough through the shaft. This cookie press met all my requirements. It went throught the dough like it was all butter. It made the job much easier as these are my families favorite cookie for the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: martha checorski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can do a lot of things with this handy cookie maker. A must have item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its okay for 2-3 times a year. Dont really use it any more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Gen R

customer_reviews.title: Broke Almost Immediately
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning this item, which is sad as I really had my hopes up. It survived a whopping 3 batches of spritz cookies before cracking all the way up the side. Before anyone asks, no, the pressure wasn't too high as the cookies were coming out just fine (that was my first thought, too...) Also, a couple of the disks weren't full circles, but there wasn't leakage as the cap rim covered the gap. As I said, I'm returning it and going to try to find a sturdier press, maybe one that's all metal.
customer_reviews.author: Yasoda Dei Conti

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a long time cookie press user. My last cookie press was a Kuhn-Rikon and lasted probably close to 20 years. Made thousands of cookies. So I bought a new Kuhn Rikon. This cookie press works very well - even better than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: High Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Bad Experience All Around
customer_reviews.text: This was a HUGE disappointment. You are not guaranteed success unless you follow the recipes that are included. The recipe for "spritz" cookies makes a very sticky dough that is difficult to work with, but apparently that is the point. The problem with this sort of dough consistency is that the dough will spread horribly during baking, resulting in misshaped blobs. To add insult to injury, the cookies were hard as rocks within an hour of cooling and I did not over bake (they were barely brown). It's too bad that the cookie presses of the old days could not be recreated.
customer_reviews.author: dlr5628

customer_reviews.title: Mechanical advantage of squeze handel is poor
customer_reviews.text: Mechanical advantage of handle is so poor that it is difficult to squeeze the dough out onto the half sheet unless you make very soft (runny) dough.
customer_reviews.author: Fotos-effects

customer_reviews.title: Occasional use OK
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty cheap. I don't use this that often so it will do. Not for a serious decorater.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: This cookie press is great for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: First cookie presser I ever used. Worked like a charm the first time I used it. It does make rather small cookies
customer_reviews.author: Wanda M. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cookie press!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this press for my husband who wanted to learn how to make the Christmas Spritz cookies his mother has baked for him for over 47 years. He hasn't ever used a cookie press and his very first batch turned out perfect (see images uploaded)!! He made many more sets and gave them away as Christmas presents with rave reviews from all recipients. This is a sturdy press and clean up and storage are a breeze. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mix

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had one with batteries before and it wasn't powerful enough so I bought this one
customer_reviews.author: Allison Hosein

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT GIFT
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the cookie press for our 11 year old grand-daughter b/c we hoped she would carry on her Great Grandma's Christmas Tradition of giving cookie plates to friends and neighbors. We had our Christmas Celebration early b/c she would be away for Christmas. Part of our celebration was an afternoon of baking cookies. She loved the gift and easily produced well shaped cookies after the first couple tries. She also decorated the holly wreaths with leaves and berries. A great gift for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used cookie presses for decades and was so disappointed when my cookie shooter finally died. Although I have bought other products to replace it none have been at all satisfactory until this one. My family was thrilled to again have spritz cookies among our favorites for Christmas treats. Also tried the decorator tips which performed beautifully. I will be sure to use it often for even casual deserts. The storage container is perfect. I highly recommend this product. So easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Laverne Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Cookie Press Win!
customer_reviews.text: I went through not one, but two cookie presses this holiday season, and neither could handle my mother's buttery spritz recipe. After one mechanical press and one electrical press failed miserably, I ordered this one based on the Amazon reviews. I figured, "Well, the Swiss have mastered chocolate and banking, maybe they can engineer a good cookie press." The Swiss didn't let me down. This press is awesome. It's easy to put together, dishwasher safe (yay!) and it handled my mother's recipe like a champ. It's so easy to use, I wondered how I've lived without it for so long. Here's hoping that it lasts me for many years!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Fix

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a cookie press like my mom had when I was growing up. It was hard to find a quality press. This made it worth it for the price by having the case and decorating tips. They really are a great added bonus. We made a bunch of Spritz cookies over Christmas and this press did not disappoint! After buying a cheaper version, it was worth it to get this. It's not the same quality of the old-school metal ones, but those are so hard to find these days.
customer_reviews.author: Derek M Haas

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this! I previously had a Wilton Cookie Pro ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this! I previously had a Wilton Cookie Pro Ultra II that broke after only two years, and I only use it during Christmas time, so I got this one instead. This press is AWESOME!!! The discs are metal so they don't break as easily and the trigger is super easy, creating the perfect cookie. The cons: the cookies themselves are a little small and the cylinder for the dough is small so you will have to refill it often.
customer_reviews.author: Christine AZ

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfull Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfull product that works beatifully. For the first time in my life I was able to make spritz cookies. Once you get the timeing right it is easy to make perfect little cookies. Keep in mind that some of the shapes work better than others. For example, the christmas tree, pointsettia and wreath shapes worked very well, while the candy cane shape did not. It is easy to clean and the storage box is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Abbey

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon Clear Cookie Press with Decorating tips
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Mom's press that she used in their bakery from the 1950's. It finally saw its last days. Duct tape wasn't holding it anymore & when I saw this one, I think this one may be the one I pass down to my children. I am used to twisting so this is a bit different as a trigger. I haven't it yet so I will update after this Christmas Season ends. Fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: E. I.

customer_reviews.title: Using to decorate cupcakes
customer_reviews.text: This is much easier to use than the pampered chef or the wilton ones I've had that both broke, This can handle the pressure some frostings have. I do not like the sharpness on the ratchet, but it gets the job done, easy to clean, assemble and use. I have not used it to make cookies.
customer_reviews.author: J. Send

customer_reviews.title: cookie press
customer_reviews.text: I have been baking for over 40 years and I have got to say that this is one of the best cookie press I have ever used. It works very good and it is so easy. I wish I had this about 40 years ago! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Kintz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome press!
customer_reviews.text: I used the press to make some Christmas cookies and my kids helped me use this press to make cookies. We did use the recipe it came with in instrucions and it was fabulous! My kids had fun making cookies with me and I highly recommend the product!
customer_reviews.author: Tricky1

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Press....
customer_reviews.text: I finially found a press that worked! I have tried the battery ones with no luck. JUst about to give up on the whole idea of making press cookies when I read the reviews on this one. This one works....press cookies are touchy though. YOu must read the directions and go by them. Love the fact it's in a case too...Thank you so much! Now it can be FUN to make these little cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi C. Newton

customer_reviews.title: Dont ask
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the dubious purpose of filling hot dogs with whipped cream cheese. I know - it doesn't sound good but they are evidently very popular in certain groups. It worked very well and could probably be adapted to other similar purposes that sound a little better - maybe filling fried food with jelly. Be creative.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Mathieu

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased an inexpensive cookie press last year that was all plastic and it was very difficult to use, so I decided to check on Amazon. This was perfect, not too expensive, but worked really well. Lots of decoration choices, and fast easy cookies. I would definately recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Practice
customer_reviews.text: This is easy enough to clean and use. I love the storage box. It takes a bit of concentration and practice for this to become easier than other methods of cookie making. After you get the hang of it, it is a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Another Paid Worker

customer_reviews.title: Nice cookie press for the money!
customer_reviews.text: If you follow the recipe book with the press, it will be easy. If not, it can be tricky. I rolled my dough inside of cellophane / plastic wrap into a log to the approximate size of the cylinder. Minimize any air pockets when filling the cylinder and the cookies turn out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CYNTHIA N

customer_reviews.title: COOKIES, BABY!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been very pleased with the results we get using the cookie press. Our old one finally gave up (after 60 years!) and this one had the least negatives in the reviews. If you are patient and follow the directions, this little instrument delivers perfect spritz cookies. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Karen Young

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old plastic one. This is very sturdy and easy to use. I wish there were more cookie dies than decorating tips. I think decorating tips would need lots of practice.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: After using an older type cookie press this one works like a piece of cake. My hands/wrists do not get tired and the cookies are more uniform. The seller was prompt and on time.
customer_reviews.author: Namma

customer_reviews.title: great cookie maker!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice spritz maker. My mistake was using non stick cookie sheets instead of plain sheets. Plain sheets allow the dough to stick and non stick repels it.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Carol E. Lindman

customer_reviews.title: Great for Spritz cookies.  The consistency of the recipe with the press was correct but the flavor was off slightly.  Traditiona
customer_reviews.text: The consistency of the recipe with the press was correct but the flavor was off slightly. Traditional recipe used by my wife tastes great but didn't form as well. More experimenting needed but press worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Camel

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm so over the moon excited at how well this worked. Even though the dough got a little warm the press itself never got gummed up. It worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for Price Paid
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality product and a good replacement to my old one. I highly recommend this product and think it is the best option out their for pressed cookies. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CFfamily

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon Clear Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice product but was disappointed in the size of the tube and the disks. Also have difficulty with the lever, it is really hard to get the dough out when you near the end of the tube. The storage box is really nice. The description should give more detail as to the size of the tube and disks.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Booth

customer_reviews.title: wife loves this
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this. She has arthritis but no problems using this. We had an electric one that broke and is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: Sugarman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, easy to clean, far superior to the last cookie press we purchased.
customer_reviews.text: It works as it should and you can completely disassemble it for thorough cleaning. Highly recommended! I can't imagine a better model!
customer_reviews.author: JWH

customer_reviews.title: Works better than my grandmothers because it does not make your ...
customer_reviews.text: Works better than my grandmothers because it does not make your hand sore when making lots of Spritz at Christmas time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Nealy

customer_reviews.title: Classic cookie press
customer_reviews.text: Great, classic cookie press. Works well, stores in its own plastic box.
customer_reviews.author: hollybloom24

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product... Quality materials...Easy clean up if u do so immediately after use... Would highly recommend...
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was for my daughter in law. My son broke hers. It was appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Engels

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design! My daughter is so happy that she ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design! My daughter is so happy that she can now create designs NO SWEAT! The workmanship seemed solid. I say 'seemed' because this product is made in China (now PRC) and anything made in China is often single use. With this in mind I told my daughter that we should not refrigerate our sugar cookie dough before using because then it will be stiff and might break the plastic. Some reviews here complained of the cylinder breaking. It will if you're not careful. Overall the product is very good buy. I am happy I bought it. I just don't know how long it will last (made in China)
customer_reviews.author: Cam A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift, but my friend says it works great
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl M

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Great cookie press! I used it to make spritz cookies and it was easy to use and my kids loved helping with it. There are plenty of different disks included and it is easy to change them out. Also easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: rcj

customer_reviews.title: Wise purchase
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for my long dead Mirro. The only thing missing is a template for a long bar cookie that I used to make by sandwiching chocolate between two layers.
customer_reviews.author: DragonLady

product_meta.title: Kuhn Rikon Clear Cookie Press with Decorating Tips and Storage Box
product_meta.description: Hearts, pinwheels, ovals and squares - make dozens of yummy cookies in a flash with the Kuhn Rikon Cookie Press. The stainless steel trigger mechanism allows easy, one-handed (whether you're left or right-handed!) cookie making using any of the 14 interchangeable disks. Included are 6 pastry nozzles for custom decorating cookies, cakes and more. Use it for filling hors d'oeuvres or piping mashed potatoes onto entrees. A see-through plastic barrel lets you quickly determine how much of the contents are left. Comes apart for easy clean-up and is dishwasher safe. Clear storage box keeps cookie press, disks and decorating tips together and ready for the next use. Recipes included.
feature_bullets: Press extrudes cookie dough through 14 unique steel disks

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars191 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
